DataElement.preferredName: Index Date To Follow-up Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's last follow-up appointment or contact.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Index Date To Last Follow-up Day
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study.

Concepts.definition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

Concepts.definition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Priority 3 of caDSR Requests Q12018 Dictionary Updates for Review (supplement). 3.14.18 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Determining the number or amount of something.
